title: Disabled Veterans Property Tax Exemption
summary: Property tax exemption for qualifying disabled veterans or their surviving spouses in California.

requirements.notes: California offers basic ($100K compounded) and low-income ($150K compounded) exemption levels; amounts vary annually.

eligibilityNotes: Generally requires 100% service-connected disability or qualifying circumstances. Surviving spouses may be eligible. Apply through the County Assessor.

title: Vehicle Registration Fee Waiver (Disabled Veteran)
summary: Waiver of vehicle registration and license fees for qualifying disabled veterans.

requirements.notes: Applies to one vehicle used by or for the veteran.

eligibilityNotes: Requires Disabled Veteran license plates issued by the California DMV.

title: Disabled Veteran License Plates
summary: Special license plates providing parking and fee benefits to qualifying disabled veterans.
eligibilityNotes: Issued by the California DMV upon verification of VA disability status.

title: College Fee Waiver for Veteran Dependents (Plan A & B)
summary: Tuition and fee waivers at California public colleges for eligible dependents of veterans.

requirements.notes: Plan A generally requires service-connected disability or death; Plan B is income-based.

eligibilityNotes: Applies to dependents and spouses in qualifying circumstances. Administered by the California Department of Veterans Affairs.

title: 100% Disabled Veteran Tuition Waiver
summary: Full tuition and fee waiver at CSU, UC, and California Community Colleges for 100% disabled veterans and qualifying dependents.

requirements.notes: Veteran must be 100% disabled OR receive compensation at 100% due to unemployability.

eligibilityNotes: Spouses, registered domestic partners, and children of 100% disabled veterans, veterans who died of service-connected causes, or were MIA/POW also eligible.

title: California National Guard Education Assistance Award Program
summary: Covers all or portion of costs at selected California state institutions for active Guard members.

requirements.notes: Guard members must remain in active status while attending school. GPA, academic program, and enrollment requirements apply.

eligibilityNotes: Available to California National Guard members in good standing.

title: California State Veterans Homes
summary: Long-term care homes providing housing and medical services for eligible veterans and certain spouses.

requirements.notes: Admission depends on medical need, eligibility determination, and bed availability. 8 locations statewide.

eligibilityNotes: Applicants must meet VA and California eligibility criteria. Locations: Barstow, Chula Vista, Fresno, Lancaster, Redding, Ventura, West Los Angeles, Yountville. Spouses may qualify in limited cases.

title: Distinguished Veteran Pass (50%+ Disabled)
summary: Free lifetime entry to all California state parks, beaches, and boat launches for disabled veterans.

requirements.notes: Also available to former POWs and Medal of Honor recipients.

eligibilityNotes: Includes camping and day use. Not valid for special events, group campsites, or commercial use. May have convenience fee for online reservations. Apply at any CA State Park.

title: California Veterans Employment Preference
summary: Veterans may receive preference points when applying for California state civil service positions.

requirements.notes: Preference eligibility depends on discharge status and wartime service; disabled veterans may receive additional points.

eligibilityNotes: Honorably discharged veterans automatically rank at top of eligibility list when they pass a test for state employment. Documentation such as DD-214 is required.

title: Free Annual Sport Fishing & Hunting License (70%+ Disabled)
summary: Free annual sport fishing and hunting license for veterans with 70% or higher service-connected disability.

requirements.notes: Veteran must be California resident with VA disability rating of 70% or greater.

eligibilityNotes: Requires proof of VA disability rating and proof of California residence. Licenses are issued through California Department of Fish and Wildlife.

title: Reduced-Fee Hunting & Fishing Licenses (50-69% Disabled Veterans)
summary: California offers reduced-fee hunting and fishing licenses to veterans with 50-69% service-connected disability.

requirements.notes: Veteran must have a service-connected disability rating between 50-69%.

eligibilityNotes: Requires California residency and VA disability documentation. Licenses are issued through California Department of Fish and Wildlife.

title: Veteran Designation on California Driver License / ID
summary: Eligible veterans may add a Veteran designation to a California driver license or identification card.

requirements.notes: Requires verification of veteran status through CalVet prior to DMV visit.

eligibilityNotes: Veterans must obtain a Veteran Status Verification Form from CalVet and present it at a DMV office.

title: California Toll Bridge Discounts for Disabled Veterans
summary: Disabled veterans may qualify for toll bridge discounts or exemptions on certain California toll facilities.

requirements.notes: Eligibility and benefits vary by region and toll authority.

eligibilityNotes: Discounts are region-specific (e.g., Bay Area bridges). Veterans must apply through the appropriate toll authority.

title: California State Veterans Cemeteries
summary: State-operated veterans cemeteries providing burial options for eligible veterans and family members.

requirements.notes: Eligibility generally mirrors VA national cemetery eligibility; availability varies by location.

eligibilityNotes: Locations: Igo, Seaside, Riverside National Cemetery. Pre-need eligibility determination is recommended.

title: Disabled Veteran Business Enterprise (DVBE) Program
summary: 3% state contracting preference for businesses at least 51% owned by disabled veterans.

requirements.notes: Business must be 51% owned by one or more disabled veterans who are California residents.

eligibilityNotes: Provides certified disabled veteran-owned businesses an advantage in state contracting. Business certification required through CA Department of General Services.

title: Business License Fee Waiver for Veteran Peddlers
summary: Waiver of municipal, county, and state business license fees for honorably discharged veterans who peddle goods.

requirements.notes: Applies to veterans who hawk, peddle, or vend goods from a fixed location.

eligibilityNotes: Honorably discharged veterans may receive waiver of business license fees as well as other related taxes and fees.

title: CalVet Home Loan Program
summary: Low-interest home, farm, and mobile home loans for California veterans with competitive rates and quick processing.

requirements.notes: Must have honorable discharge and minimum 90 days active service. Includes flood, earthquake, and disaster coverage.

eligibilityNotes: Available for home purchase, farm purchase, mobile home, construction, and home improvement. Loans processed quickly with competitive rates.

title: Basic Veterans Property Tax Exemption ($4,000)
summary: $4,000 real property or personal property exemption for honorably discharged veterans or qualifying family members.

requirements.notes: Veteran or spouse/pensioned-parent of deceased honorably discharged veteran. Not eligible if property valued at $5,000+ ($10,000+ married).

eligibilityNotes: Available to veterans, spouses, or pensioned parents of deceased honorably discharged veterans.

title: California Military Family Relief Fund (CMFRF)
summary: Short-term financial assistance grants for California Guard members and families affected by mobilization and deployment.

requirements.notes: For state Guard members and/or families affected by mobilization and deployment.

eligibilityNotes: Provides grants for short-term financial assistance during deployment-related hardship.

title: California Military Department GI Bill Award Program
summary: Up to 100% tuition and fees at California public universities, CSU, community colleges, and eligible private institutions for active California National Guard, State Guard, and Naval Militia members.

requirements.notes: Must be active member with 2+ years service. Must maintain 3+ units/semester and 2.0 GPA.

eligibilityNotes: Active members of California Army or Air National Guard, California State Guard, or California Naval Militia. Must serve 2 years in unit, agree to remain active throughout participation, and pursue certificate/degree not currently possessed. Must maintain 3+ academic units per semester and 2.0 cumulative GPA. Must be California resident for at least 1 year. Priority deadline April 30 annually; applications accepted first-come first-served after that until funds exhausted. Apply through California Student Aid Commission.
